Question: How often do you complete assigned tasks fully without leaving loose ends?
How often do you verify task requirements with the stakeholder before execution to ensure clarity?
How often do you take ownership of mistakes and immediately share corrective actions?
How often do you provide timely progress updates without reminders?
How often do you ensure deliverables meet agreed standards before closure?
How often do you deliver on commitments even when faced with challenges?
How often do you communicate early when a timeline or deliverable is at risk?
How often do you ensure dependencies on your tasks are cleared for others to proceed?
How often do you maintain visibility of your work using shared trackers or dashboards?
How often do you reinforce reliability by completing both visible and behind-the-scenes tasks consistently?
How often do you verify accuracy and completeness before submission?
How often do you apply feedback from earlier reviews to improve your next deliverable?
How often do you initiate small improvements that enhance quality across repeated tasks?
How often do you maintain documentation that supports traceability and clarity for others?
How often do you model a “right-first-time” attitude that influences peers’ approach to quality?
How often do you identify risks or blockers early and take ownership to address them?
How often do you suggest process improvements that make delivery smoother for the team?
How often do you show initiative in handling small issues independently within scope?
How often do you escalate systemic issues promptly and responsibly?
How often do you help peers anticipate or mitigate recurring delivery challenges?
How often do you uphold team reliability by ensuring your output doesn’t delay others?
How often do you coordinate with peers to ensure accountability across linked tasks?
How often do you maintain transparency on progress, risks, and blockers for stakeholders?
How often do you take ownership of shared goals rather than only personal tasks?
How often do you set an example of responsible behavior in hybrid or virtual collaboration?
Do I provide visibility of my progress and challenges to all stakeholders?
Do I take initiative to solve or escalate issues without waiting for reminders?
How often do I check whether my output enables others to succeed?
Do I apply feedback consistently to improve quality?
What small habit can I build this month to strengthen reliability?
Do I connect changes to business outcomes?
Do I re-prioritize by impact?
How quickly did I apply my latest learning?
Did I run a review and share lessons?
Did I help others stay focused and motivated?
Do I balance contribution so everyone feels included, not just vocal members?
Do I mentor new peers to help them integrate faster?
How do I handle conflict early without waiting for escalation?
Do I recognize and celebrate team success as much as individual effort?

Question: How can my problem-solving raise team decision quality?
Do I adjust both tone and medium for different stakeholders?
How often do I proactively update before being asked?
Am I including remote colleagues consistently?
What data or evidence can I use to strengthen my ideas?
When updating your peer, how often do you explain steps rather than just the result?
When speaking to a manager, how often do you summarize outcomes and next steps clearly?
Before explaining, how often do you check if your audience already knows the background?
How often do you use analogies or examples to make complex ideas simple?
In cross-team updates, how often do you replace jargon with business-friendly terms?
How often do you share progress without being asked?
When a deadline nears, how often do you remind others in advance?
How often do you flag risks early before they become issues?
When a new teammate joins, how often do you brief them so they can catch up quickly?
How often do you send short structured updates to keep everyone aligned?
When suggesting ideas, how often do you present two or more options with pros and cons?
How often do you frame ideas in terms of value or impact for others?
In discussions, how often do you express disagreement respectfully and firmly?
How often do you adapt tone or phrasing to fit the audience (formal vs casual)?
When peers hesitate to share, how often do you invite and encourage their input?
When influencing decisions, how often do you back your point with supporting data or evidence?
How often do you use bullet points or headings in written updates for clarity?
How often do you choose the right medium (chat, mail, meeting) for urgency and audience?
In hybrid meetings, how often do you actively include remote colleagues’ views?
How often do you circulate concise written summaries of key decisions?
How often do you focus messages on essentials instead of lengthy detail?
When collaborating asynchronously, how often do you ensure clarity for teammates in other time zones?
How often do you check if your message was understood as intended?
When you receive feedback, how often do you adjust your communication style?
In larger meetings, how often do you speak up with confidence?
How often do you handle disagreement calmly without diluting clarity?
How often do you acknowledge others publicly to reinforce a positive culture?
How often do you prioritize team outcomes over personal preferences in decision-making?
When workload feels uneven, how often do you offer to balance effort across the team?
How often do you help teammates see challenges as “our problem,” not “my problem”?
When a teammate struggles, how often do you offer help without waiting to be asked?
How often do you realign your own priorities when the team’s success depends on collective focus?
How often do you share relevant information or documents proactively with other teams?
When work depends on another function, how often do you keep them updated on progress or blockers?
How often do you clarify ownership when a task spans multiple teams?
How often do you use shared digital tools (trackers, dashboards, boards) to make work transparent?
How often do you help align timelines when schedules between teams conflict?
How often do you invite quieter or remote teammates to contribute ideas?
How often do you guide new colleagues on how to work effectively within the team?
How often do you recognize contributions from supporting roles (QA, Admin, Ops)?
How often do you adjust meeting facilitation so everyone’s voice is heard?
How often do you create a safe space where teammates can share mistakes or concerns without fear?
How often do you notice tensions early and raise them calmly before they escalate?
When misunderstandings arise, how often do you clarify objectively without taking sides?
How often do you focus on facts and shared outcomes during disagreements?
When under pressure, how often do you maintain composure and respect in tone?
How often do you steer the team back to shared goals after differences appear?
How often do you take ownership for team deadlines in addition to your own tasks?
When you promise to support a teammate, how often do you follow through fully?
How often do you keep shared trackers and documents updated for team visibility?
How often do you step in temporarily for a teammate who’s unavailable to keep momentum?
How often do you celebrate and share credit publicly for team achievements?
